hero.title: A story of two
hero.alt: The chefs of Lait Thym Sel restaurant

chefs.intro:
Lait Thym Sel was born from a shared vision.
That of a sincere, demanding cuisine, guided by gesture and time.
story: After six years spent in the historic district of La Doutre in Angers, we chose in December 2023 to cross the Maine River and open a new place.
In September 2025, a major water damage incident forced us to rethink our organization.
Our new home, an elegant brick building, was transformed with heightened attention.
Today, we return with a more personal and intimate place.
chefs.signature:
Milk for indulgence and comfort.
Thyme for creativity and character.
Salt for rawness and balance.

duo.title: A story of two
intro: Before being a restaurant, Lait Thym Sel is a story of partnership.
Two paths, two sensibilities, one shared level of excellence.
From the very beginning, we have built this house together.

fanny.name: Fanny Morvan
bio: Born in Annecy, Fanny discovered her calling for cuisine at a very young age.
She spent three years in England developing a strong sense of hospitality.
Her international experience shaped a precise and ambitious personality.

gaetan.name: Gaëtan Morvan
bio: Born in Angers, Gaëtan entered the kitchen at 15 through apprenticeship.
He trained with Michel Guérard and Alain Ducasse.
His cuisine is influenced by Japanese minimalism.

closing: When Fanny and Gaëtan met, the connection was immediate.
In 2017, Lait Thym Sel was born.
Today, they continue their journey together, more united than ever.
